packages.name: NAME OF PACKAGE
packages.installer: INSTALLER USED FOR PACKAGE (pacman, aur, pip)
run_commands: LIST OF COMMANDS TO RUN AFTER THE FILE IS INSTALLED
IT CAN CONTAIN ENVIRONMENT VARIABLES SUCH AS $USER and $HOME
packages.autostart: EITHER null OR A STRING WHICH WILL BE ADDED TO THE AUTOSTART FILE
comments: MISC COMMENTS THAT WILL BE SHOWN TO THE USER AFTER THE PACKAGE IS INSTALLED
THOSE WILL CONTAIN THE INFO '[i]' HEADING

files.name: FILENAME
files.source: WHERE TO COPY/LINK/SOURCE THE FILE FROM, IF null FILE WILL BE CREATED WITH text AS ITS CONTENTS
files.text: TEXT TO PUT INSIDE THE FILE
comments: MISC COMMENTS THAT WILL BE SHOWN TO THE USER AFTER THE FILE IS CONFIGURED
THOSE WILL CONTAIN THE INFO '[i]' HEADING
